title: C86-1081

sentences.text: Determiners play an important role in conveying the meaning of an utterance , but they have often been disregarded , perhaps because it seemed more important to devise methods to grasp the global meaning of a sentence , even if not in a precise way .
Another problem with determiners is their inherent ambiguity .

In this paper we propose a logical formalism , which , among other things , is suitable for representing determiners without forcing a particular interpretation when their meaning is still not clear .

Entity-in_this_paper.label: In this paper
Entity-in_this_paper.description: This paper proposes a logical formalism that represents determiners without forcing a particular interpretation.

Entity-a_logical_formalism.label: a logical formalism
Entity-a_logical_formalism.description: A proposed method or system of logical representation that can accurately convey the meaning of determiners, including those with inherent ambiguity.

Entity-determiner_without_forcing_a_part.label: determiners without forcing a particular interpretation when their meaning is still not clear
aliases: determiners without forcing a particular interpretation when their meaning is still not clear
Entity-determiner_without_forcing_a_part.description: A type of linguistic entity that refers to words or phrases used to indicate the scope and reference of nouns, which can be ambiguous and require a formalism for representation without imposing a specific interpretation.

mentions.local_name: determiners without forcing a particular interpretation when their meaning is still not clear

Entity-determiner.label: Determiners
Entity-determiner.description: Words or phrases that modify nouns and pronouns by specifying their quantity, quality, or relationship to other entities.

Entity-logical_formalism.label: logical formalism
Entity-logical_formalism.description: A theoretical framework or methodology that uses logical principles and structures to represent, reason about, or formalize concepts, ideas, or systems.

Entity-the_meaning_of_an_utterance.label: the meaning of an utterance
Entity-the_meaning_of_an_utterance.description: The concept that refers to the intended or implied sense conveyed by an utterance, including its semantic content and pragmatic implications.

Entity-utterance.label: utterance
Entity-utterance.description: A spoken or written expression that conveys information or an idea.

Entity-method_to_grasp_the_global_meanin.label: methods to grasp the global meaning of a sentence
aliases: methods to grasp the global meaning of a sentence
Entity-method_to_grasp_the_global_meanin.description: Approaches or techniques used to comprehend and understand the overall significance or gist of a sentence.

mentions.local_name: methods to grasp the global meaning of a sentence

Entity-problem.label: problem
Entity-problem.description: A concept or issue that requires resolution, analysis, or consideration.

Entity-sentence.label: sentence
Entity-sentence.description: A unit of language that expresses a complete thought or idea.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A written work that presents research or ideas in an organized and systematic manner.

Entity-method.label: methods
Entity-method.description: A systematic approach or technique used for achieving a specific goal or solving a problem.

summary: Determiners play an important role in conveying the meaning of an utterance , but they have often been disregarded , perhaps because it seemed more important to devise methods to grasp the global meaning of a sentence , even if not in a precise way . Another problem with determiners is their inherent ambiguity . In this paper we propose a logical formalism , which , among other things , is suitable for representing determiners without forcing a particular interpretation when their meaning is still not clear .

Predicate-play_an_important_role_in_conv.label: play an important role in conveying
Predicate-play_an_important_role_in_conv.description: The predicate 'play an important role in conveying' indicates that the subject (e.g., determiners) have a crucial function in transmitting or communicating information to others, as represented by the object (e.g., the meaning of an utterance). This connection suggests that the subject's presence, characteristics, or properties are essential for understanding or interpreting the intended message.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a possession or association relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject possesses, contains, or is characterized by the qualities or attributes described in the object.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To suggest or recommend something as a potential solution, approach, or framework for consideration and evaluation.

Predicate-is_suitable_for_representing.label: is suitable for representing
Predicate-is_suitable_for_representing.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (a linguistic formalism or framework) has the capacity to effectively convey or express the concepts, ideas, or structures represented by an object (such as Determiners). In other words, it suggests that the subject is capable of capturing and conveying the essence or meaning of the object in a meaningful way.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (in this case, an utterance) is related to or encompasses another concept (the object, which is a sentence), implying a hierarchical relationship where the subject represents a more specific instance of the broader category represented by the object.
